design_philosophy.primary_approach: Professional ERP interface with clean industrial layout
key_principles: Data density with clarity - maximize information without overwhelming
Functional beauty - every element serves a purpose
Scanability - users should find information in under 3 seconds
Consistency - predictable patterns across all modules
Efficiency - minimize clicks and cognitive load for daily tasks
design_philosophy.target_users: Manufacturing professionals (Store managers, Purchase officers, QC inspectors, Accounts team)
design_philosophy.usage_context: Desktop-first, extended daily use, production environment

typography.philosophy: Clear hierarchy with industrial precision. Avoid decorative fonts - prioritize legibility for data-heavy interfaces.

headings.usage: Page titles, section headers, module names
headings.rationale: Professional, technical feel with excellent readability. Designed for IBM's enterprise software.

body.usage: Form labels, table content, body text, descriptions
body.rationale: Optimized for screen reading with clear distinction between similar characters (critical for SKUs, codes)

data.usage: Item codes, SKUs, numbers, IDs, technical identifiers
data.rationale: Monospace ensures alignment and easy scanning of alphanumeric codes

installation_commands: fontFamily: { sans: ['Work Sans', 'system-ui', 'sans-serif'], heading: ['IBM Plex Sans', 'system-ui', 'sans-serif'], mono: ['IBM Plex Mono', 'monospace'] }

color_system.rationale: ERP systems demand precision and clarity. High contrast ensures readability during extended use. Minimal color usage keeps focus on data.

base.description: Slightly cool-tinted whites and greys for reduced eye strain

primary.description: Deep professional blue - used ONLY for primary CTAs and active states

accent.description: Functional colors - used only to convey status or action type

usage_rules.primary_color_usage: LIMIT primary color to CTAs (buttons, links) and active navigation items only. Do NOT use for backgrounds or large surfaces.
usage_rules.status_indicators: Always pair status colors with icons or text labels for accessibility
usage_rules.data_visualization: Use chart colors from Shadcn chart palette - already optimized for accessibility
usage_rules.hover_states: ALWAYS explicitly set both background AND text color on hover to maintain contrast
usage_rules.focus_states: Use ring utilities with primary color: focus:ring-2 focus:ring-primary focus:ring-offset-2

contrast_requirements.status_badges: Use colored backgrounds with dark text for better contrast than colored text

layout_system.structure: Sidebar navigation + Top header + Main content area

sidebar.content: Logo, navigation menu, user profile, collapse toggle

header.content: Breadcrumbs, page title, global search, notifications, user menu

main_content.max_width: Full width with internal constraints per section

spacing_system.philosophy: Generous spacing for breathing room, but denser than marketing pages

master_lists.pattern: Header with actions → Filters → Data table → Pagination

component_strategy.philosophy: Use Shadcn components for ALL interactive elements. Customize styling but keep accessibility intact.

forms.customization: Override default styling with Tailwind classes. Ensure labels are always visible.
forms.validation: Use inline validation with error messages below fields

data_display.card_usage: Minimal - prefer flat sections with borders. Use cards only for dashboard widgets.

navigation.patterns: Breadcrumbs for hierarchy, Tabs for related views, Dropdown for actions

overlays.sheet_usage: Side panel for filters or detail views

custom_components_needed: StatusBadge - Reusable status indicator with color coding
DataCard - Dashboard metric card with icon, value, change indicator
ApprovalTimeline - Visual timeline for approval workflows
StockLevelIndicator - Visual gauge for stock levels
QuickActionButton - Icon button with tooltip for table actions

surface_treatments.primary_strategy: Flat with subtle borders - Grid Borders (Technical Look)

shadows.usage: Minimal shadow usage - rely on borders for definition

borders.philosophy: Visible grid structure - borders define zones and hierarchy

corner_radius.philosophy: Subtle roundness - professional without being playful

motion_and_interactions.philosophy: Minimal, purposeful animations. Feedback over decoration.

transitions.property_specific: Use transition-colors, transition-opacity, transition-transform - NEVER transition: all
transitions.duration: 150ms for micro-interactions, 200ms for state changes, 300ms for page transitions

loading_states.skeleton: Use Skeleton component for loading tables and forms
loading_states.progress: Use Progress component for multi-step processes

accessibility.keyboard_navigation: Ensure all interactive elements are keyboard accessible
accessibility.focus_visible: Clear focus indicators on all interactive elements

icons.rationale: Already installed, comprehensive set, consistent style

data_visualization.color_palette: Use chart-1 through chart-5 from Tailwind config
data_visualization.accessibility: Ensure charts have text alternatives and are keyboard navigable

sections: Summary cards (4 metrics: Total Items, Low Stock Alerts, Pending POs, Pending Approvals)
dashboard.interactions: Click on metrics to drill down to relevant pages

master_forms.layout: Two-column form with full-width sections where needed
master_forms.pattern: Page header → Form → Action buttons (Save, Cancel)

list_pages.layout: Page header → Filter bar → Data table → Pagination
list_pages.filters: Collapsible filter panel or inline filters above table

transaction_forms.pattern: Header info → Line items table → Totals → Actions
transaction_forms.line_items: Editable table with add/remove row functionality

reports.layout: Filter panel → Report display → Export actions

mobile_adaptations.tables: Horizontal scroll with frozen first column

responsive_behavior.priority: Desktop-first design, but ensure mobile usability for approvals and quick checks

testing_attributes.philosophy: All interactive and key informational elements MUST include data-testid attributes

accessibility_requirements.wcag_level: AA minimum, AAA for text contrast
accessibility_requirements.screen_readers: Proper ARIA labels and semantic HTML
accessibility_requirements.focus_management: Clear focus indicators and logical tab order
accessibility_requirements.color_independence: Never rely on color alone to convey information

performance_considerations.table_virtualization: Use virtual scrolling for tables with 100+ rows
performance_considerations.lazy_loading: Lazy load charts and heavy components
performance_considerations.caching: Cache master data and frequently accessed lists

design_quality: Avoid generic centered layouts and uniform styling
Create depth through layered design with z-index hierarchy
Use subtle shadows and borders for definition
NEVER use universal transitions (transition: all) - use specific properties
NEVER center-align the app container - disrupts natural reading flow
color_usage: NEVER use AI assistant emojis for icons
Use modern button styles with interaction animations
Ensure hover states have explicit text and background colors
Dark colors look good independently - avoid dark gradients
component_reuse: Create new components matching existing patterns
Components use named exports, Pages use default exports
feedback_mechanisms: Provide immediate feedback for all user actions
Show loading states for async operations
spacing_and_layout: Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable initially
Containers with borders MUST have internal padding
Grid items must be direct children of grid containers
Use align-items: start on grids, add align-self: stretch to individual items as needed

implementation_notes.file_structure: Organize by feature modules (Dashboard, Masters, Purchase, Quality, Inventory, Reports, Settings)
implementation_notes.routing: Use React Router with nested routes for module sections
implementation_notes.state_management: Context API for global state, local state for component-specific data
implementation_notes.api_integration: Centralized API service layer with error handling and loading states

inspiration_sources: Modern ERP systems: SAP Fiori, Oracle Cloud, Microsoft Dynamics
Data-heavy dashboards: Tableau, Power BI, Grafana
Professional SaaS: Linear, Notion, Airtable (for clean data tables)
key_takeaways: Prioritize KPIs and frequently accessed data
Use consistent visual language across all modules
Minimize cognitive load with clear hierarchy
Support customization where possible (column visibility, saved filters)
Provide contextual help and tooltips for complex features
